comments:
I got this NPE using the latest build.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.builders.CompilerFlags.getFlag(CompilerFlags.java:92)
at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.builders.ManifestConsistencyChecker.build(ManifestConsistencyChecker.java:104)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:532)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:607)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:668)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:148)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:225)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:178)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:205)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:607)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:668)

at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuildLoop(BuildManager.java:244)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build(BuildManager.java:273)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:150)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:196)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

The line throwing the NPE is:
Preferences pref = PDE.getDefault().getPluginPreferences();

PDE.getDefault() returns the plugin instance (inst).  I can't see how it 
returns null.

Jeff, org.eclipse.pde is still in the runtime.compatibility mode and uses the 
(IPluginDescriptor) constructor.  inst is initialized in the constructor.  How 
could this happen?

Moving to Equinox, since this NPE could not have occurred if the constructor 
of the plugin class was called prior to accesssing code from the plug-in.

This sounds extremely similar to bug #61139, therefore marking as duplicate.
Olivier, do you still this problem and/or do you have steps to reproduce it.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 61139 ***

I didn't get it lately. I have no idea how to reproduce it. It simply happened
when I tried to start Eclipse. Could be a timing issue.
